meanings.definition: A person who rebukes or scolds someone.
meanings.sent1: The rebuker told the child not to touch the hot stove.
meanings.sent2: The teacher acted as a rebuker when the student misbehaved in class.
meanings.sent3: The little girl found it funny when her dog played the role of a rebuker, barking at her for eating too many cookies.
meanings.sent4: The rebuker of bad habits, the alarm clock, woke him up every morning with its loud sound.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the wise old owl was portrayed as a rebuker, guiding the young animals with gentle scoldings.

meanings.definition: To criticize or reprimand someone sharply.
meanings.sent1: She would often rebuker her brother for leaving his toys all over the house.
meanings.sent2: The coach had to rebuker the players for not following the game plan.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to rebuker its owner whenever he forgot to feed it.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to rebuker the trees, bending them with its strong winds.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes seemed to rebuker him silently, conveying her disappointment without a word.
